Photographer @gyaltsn captures the Oracle Effect in Ladakh also called the Stok Guru Tsetsu. The monks start praying and even fast for months to become spirit receptacles. Once the monks become possessed by the spirits of the oracle they can cut their bodies with swords and run around the monastery. 

Just like any other festival this festival is highly awaited by the locals because it is one from their ancient traditions and also because the spirits predict their future and make predictions of their fortunes.

If youâ€™re longing for a tropical getaway full of white sand beaches and crystal clear waters, Maldives should definitely be on top of your travel bucket list! Here are 6 things you can do in this tropical paradise:

1. Go Snorkelling - The best way to explore the reefs of Maldives is to go snorkelling in its crystal clear waters. Dive into the shallow waters and get awed by the underwater reefs and the blue waters!
ğŸ“¸ @missangievilla

2. Go Island Hopping - Maldives is made up of 1200 islands in total. These are a combination of private and local islands. The local islands in Maldives are worth paying a visit for their culture, food and architecture. You can also choose to hop between the serene white sand beaches of Maldives.
ğŸ“¸ @alexpreview

3. Surf The Waves - One of the best ways to enjoy the Maldivian sea is by going for a surfing session at the ocean. Cinnamon Dhonveli in Maldives is known to be a top surfing destination in the world. If you donâ€™t know how to surf, you can also take some lessons at other beaches in Maldives! 
ğŸ“¸ @world_in_photos_by_petra

4. Enjoy Dinner At The Beach - Maldives serves some of the most beautiful views of the sunsets and the most lip smacking sea food. Be it a romantic evening, a dinner date or just you watching the sunset, the Maldivian evening will never disappoint you! 
ğŸ“¸ @shaafil

5. Explore The Sea Life - Maldives is home to some of the most exotic marine life in the world. And you can easily view these exotic creatures and swim with them deep under the ocean by taking a deep sea dive or going for scuba diving in Maldives. 
ğŸ“¸ @pullman_maldives

6. Go Dolphin Watching - Take a dolphin excursion and spot the dolphins at the Maldivian sea as they swim and twirl around your cruise! Spotting these playful dolphins is surely one of the best experiences youâ€™ll have in Maldives.
ğŸ“¸ @laurahlp

If youâ€™re a fan of rich histories and fascinating natural wonders, Turkey surely has to be on top of your travel bucket list! 

Here are the best 6 things you can do in Turkey:

1. Visit the Aya Sofya Museum - This stunning museum located in Istanbul is known to be one of the most beautiful buildings in the world. This 6th century building holds great religious importance in Istanbul and is also a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
ğŸ“¸ @alic3lik

2. Ride a Hot Air Ballon in Cappadocia - The beautiful moon-like-surfaced rock valleys of Cappadocia are best enjoyed with a hot air balloon ride. The panoramic views of this magnificent valley along with rock cut churches of the Byzantine era will surely take your breath away.
ğŸ“¸ @asya_cappadocia

3. Photograph the Travertines of Pamukkale - Pamukkale or â€˜Cotton Castleâ€™ is known for its white travertine terraces that run down a slope making for an amazing natural wonder. The place is best photographed with a sunset in the background at dawn.
ğŸ“¸ @destinationchaser

4. Paragliding at Oludeniz - Oludeniz is one of the most beautiful beaches in Turkey. Paragliding at this destination is the best way to enjoy the views of the turquoise blue waters, the lush green forests and the white sand surrounding it. The destination also happens to be one of the best paragliding destinations in the world! 
ğŸ“¸ @siunpak

5. Explore Mount Nemrut - A world renowned archeological site, Mount Nemrut is home to the famous giant stone heads of ancient Gods. The mysterious remnants of these statues are best enjoyed during the sunrise on top of the summit. 
ğŸ“¸ @goturkey

6. Boating at Karaleylek - With a history of 9 million years, the canyons of Karaleylek are one of the oldest canyons in the world. The canyons are surrounded by blue-green waters which also allow you to explore them in a boat. 
ğŸ“¸ @mucahitmuglu

If youâ€™re a fan of offbeat travel, magnificent mountains, and unconventional landscapes, Iceland should surely be in your bucket list. Here are the top 5 things you can do at this heavenly destination:

1. Visit the SnÃ¦fellsjoÌˆkull National Park - This national park serves as a home to the world famous glacier of SnÃ¦fellsjoÌˆkull. You can hike on the many trails here or explore the lava fields, both serving magnificent views of the mighty glacier.
ğŸ“¸ @_lugamor

2. Hike to the Kirkjufell Mountain - The Kirkjufell mountain is a 463 meter high mountain in Iceland. It is also known to be the â€œmost photographed mountain in Icelandâ€, thanks to the serene fields, falls and the aurora that surrounds it at night.
ğŸ“¸ @whereisweatherby

3. Swim in a Blue Lagoon - The geothermal blue lagoon of heated seawater is one of the most popular tourist attraction in Iceland. The strikingly beautiful turquoise blue water here is known to have healing properties as it contains several minerals. 
ğŸ“¸ @_sarahlatham

4. Observe the Tectonic Plates - The Pingvellir Plain in Iceland serves home to a point where the tectonic plates are shifting and can be observed. You can observe this fascinating natural phenomena walking around the trails of the resulting gullets and rivers formed by the shifting of the plates. 
ğŸ“¸ @roughguides

5. Whale watching at Husavik - Husabik is known as the â€œWhale capital of Icelandâ€, for its history of guaranteed whale sightings. You can hire a variety of boats and tour the area to view this magnificent creature.

With its enormous basalt stacks, roaring Atlantic waves and stunning panoramas, Reynisfjara is widely considered to be the most beautiful example of Icelandâ€™s black sand beaches.Â 
According to local Icelandic folklore, these large basalt columns were once trolls trying to pull ships from the ocean to shore. However, these trolls were dim and went out too late in the night; dawn broke on the horizon, turning the trolls into solid stone.

If you breathe traveling, then you need to add Norway to your bucket list! Keep swiping and you would know why!

1. Hiking at Trolltunga - Trolltunga is one of the most scenic and spectacular cliffs in Norway, hovering 700 metres above Ringedalsvatnet lake.
The hike through high-mountain terrain up to Trolltunga (1180 m) is long and demanding, but you are rewarded with magnificent views.
@trolltungaactive
..
2. Ride the Flam Railways- Described as one of the most beautiful train journeys in the world, the Flam line is a 20.2 km long railway line between Myrdal and Aurland in Norway. The journey in this train will serve you some of the most heavenly views of Western Norwayâ€™s lush green mountains and valleys.
ğŸ¥: @wayneczx 
..
3. Sightseeing at Loen - Loen is the perfect place for exploring the mountains during the day, and pampering yourself in the evenings.
With its dramatic and spectacular scenery, Loen has been a magnet for tourists for more than a century.
ğŸ¥: @egilv 
..
4. Tromso Husky - If you are a fan of interactive adventure, then this experience is for you. Get a team of your own dogs and go riding and sliding with them for a 4 hour ride.
ğŸ¥: @nilofarbawa
..
5. Kayaking at Gudvangen - Kayaking along the narrowest fjord in the world (which also happens to be a UNESCO World Heritage Site), is beyond your wildest dreams. Starting from the Viking Village and Nordic Ventureâ€™s Kayak Base in Gudvangen, you are in for an experience of a lifetime as you paddle down the NÃ¦rÃ¸yfjord.
ğŸ¥: @doreenlivetotravel

6. Northern Lights - Nothing else in the sky looks like the Northern Lights.
They vary in colour and intensity and as opposed to the moon, sun and stars they are unpredictable and unique. They are alsocalled the night-time Aurora because they are on the night-side of the earth.

The #IntoTheWild Book Bus that was abandoned  in Alaska was removed yesterday to prevent others trying to reach it. 
#ChristopherMcCandless died in 1992 and spent his last few days in this bus. 
To give you a brief of the incident, read the below account from the book #IntoTheWild

In April 1992, McCandless hitchhiked to Alaska, where a man dropped him off at the head of the Stampede Trail. A few days later, he came upon the abandoned bus and lived there for about three months before deciding to head back to civilization.

As he attempted to make his way back, he arrived at a crossing of the Teklanika River. But because the river was running fast and high from rain and the snowmelt from glaciers, he was unable to make his way across, according to Krakauer.

Defeated, he turned around and headed back toward the bus, where he survived for about a month before succumbing to death in August 1992.

Hikers from around the world attempt to retrace McCandless' steps every year, but many have failed and have had to be rescued. Some even died.

Last February, firefighters and Alaska state troopers rescued five Italian hikers on the Stampede Trail as they were returning from visiting the abandoned bus.

Less than a year before, a Belarus woman died on the trail trying to cross the Teklanika River to visit the bus with her new husband.

The Alaska National Guard, in a release, said the bus was removed using a heavy-lift helicopter. The crew ensured the safety of a suitcase with sentimental value to the McCandless family.
The bus will be kept in a secure location while they consider various options for what to do with it. [via The Guardian]

Video Credits - @cinema.magic

The peace seekers paradise. Tag someone you wish to explore this hidden treasure of nature.
.
.
.
Perched at an altitude of 1500 m above sea level, Ziro has hills that are beautifully covered with bamboo and pine trees, surrounded with paddy fields. The town is home to a very friendly tribal group known as the Apatani tribe.
A unique fact about the Apatani tribe is that, women of this tribe used to practice a custom of getting facial tattoos!! This was done since they believed that women of the Apatani tribe were so beautiful that they had to tattoo their faces in order to not let men from other tribes steal them away!
.
.
.
.
Thank you @pratik.rajoria for this wonderful capture.

The colourful Tulips have blossomed in Kashmir, across large hectares of land in Srinagar.
But, the most surprising thing is that now the biggest tulip gardens in the world are now in the beautiful Himalayan town of Munsiyari in Uttarakhand.
Trivendra Singh Rawat, the Chief Minister of Uttarakhand tweeted the pictures of the Tulip gardens recently on his Twitter page. The CM shared that the Tulip garden is located facing the majestic Panchachuli ranges, the five famous snow-capped Himalayan mountains.
.
.
.

The Leh-Manali Highway is a high mountain road situated in India. It spans over a length of 479 km (298 mi) among the Himalaya mountain range. It passes through some of the worldâ€™s highest mountain passes in the world, with a mean altitude in between 2 to 3 miles above sea level. Uncertain weather, high altitude, extreme cold and no civilization for miles make this a very treacherous track. .

If a single image could encapsulate Hong Kong, it would be the glorious bird-eye view from the Victoria Peak. Things to do in Victoria Peak:

* Stroll around The Peak Circle Walk: The Peak Circle Walk winds around the top of the mountain and rewards hikers with the postcard view of Victoria Harbour.
* The Peak Tower and Sky Terrace 428: Enjoy the stunning 360-degree view of the Hong Kong skyline.
* Relax and rewind at The Peak Lookout.

Yas Waterworld, in Abu Dhabi, takes the land as vast as 16 football pitches and boasts 43 exotic rides, thrilling slides, and other world-class attractions. You can take home a lifetime worth experience of the worldâ€™s largest and first hydro-magnetic-triggered, 25-meter long tornado water slide. If you are a huge adrenaline junkie, the park has got waves up to 3 meters on Bubbles Barrel that is known to have the most significant surf wave in the world for body-boards and flow-boards. Besides, you can also experience Bandit Bomber, which happens to be a massive coaster of 550 meters and the very first of its kind with onboard laser and water effects. The riders can enjoy shooting water jets at their targets, triggering special effects, and dropping water bombs, while the individuals below spray water at them as and when they pass.

Things to do in Placer Cover - A visit to The Bride's Pool Waterfall.

The most scenic natural swimming pool, Bride's Pool Waterfall is a hidden treasure in Hong Kong. The glorious 15m waterfall is located in Plover Cover Country Park near Tai Mei Tuk. Highly popular amongst hikers, picnic and barbeque goers, Bride's Pool is a sight for sore eyes. The shaded foliage paths, crisscrossed by streams and rivers pleases the soul as the waterfall makes a good time for photographers.

If you are planning an enjoyable and educational day out in the Arabic city of Dubai, be sure that nothing can beat Dubai Dolphinarium. This amusement centre offers non-stop fun and entertainment in its well-maintained and advanced marine animal facility. As its name suggests, this place is famous all over the world for its unique and exquisite Dubai Dolphinarium Seal Show. Things to do in Lantau Island - Visit the Tian Tan Buddha

Seated peacefully atop a lotus flower, the Tian Tan Buddha is a commanding 112 feet tall and weighs over 34 metric tons. Visible from everywhere in Lantau Island, it looks even more majestic from a distance casting deep shadows over the hills. A statue that symbolizes harmony and peace, the Big Buddha statue and neighbouring Po Lin Monastery are one of the most important centers of Buddhism in Hong Kong.

Things to do in Tai Mo Shan - The Ng Tung Chai Waterfalls Hike 
The Ng Tung Chai Waterfall hike takes you on a tour of not one, but four gorgeous waterfalls under Tai Mo Shan. Nestled within the dense jungle on the breathtaking slopes of Tai Mo Shan mountain, the Ng Tung Chai waterfalls are one of Hong Kongâ€™s best-kept secrets.

The hike finishes at the spectacular â€˜Main Fallsâ€™, the highest in Hong Kong. Along the way, climb past rural villages and temples into a world far from Hong Kong as you know it.

The revolutionary botanical garden in Singapore, Gardens by the Bay is no less than a fantasy land that houses some of the rare orchids and plants within its marvelous structure. The three zones in this horticulture attraction- Bay South, Bay East, and Bay Central replicate the various Mediterranean climates observed across the world. This super park is home to approx 1.5 million plants and is maintained by a team of expert horticulturists, engineers, designers, as well as plant and orchid breeding professionals. Other than this, the giant Supertrees provide shade during the day and come alive by twinkling at night during the famed Gardens by the Bay light show.

Go for a Gardens by the Bay Tour and enjoy this blooming wonder with your folks. Book Your Ticket at Flat 16% Off only at Thrillophilia.com

Very few people have the guts to make a professional out of passion. Prateek Vats ( @ridewithvats ) is one such personality. This has got to be one of the most relaxing spots on the planet. TAG someone with whom you want to dangle your feet over the edge, and watch the sunset.
.
This is the Kedung Kayang Waterfall in Central Java in Indonesia. The waterfall drops approximately 130 ft (40 m), creating a spray that supports lush life on the walls of this small canyon. The mountain in the background is the Merapi Volcano. Locals say you can stand at the bottom under the falls, and there is a hidden cave behind the falls.
.

Gaumukh Tapovan; a beautiful trail passing over the origin of the Holy Ganga to the base of Shivling! TAG your friends with whom you want to plan this trek.

It is believed that the river that flows from Lord Shiva's head originates from Mt.Shivling and flows across Tapovan to merge down with Bhagirathi which originates from Gaumukh glacier and is said to be the source of holy Ganga river. Hence this stream flowing through Tapovan is named Akash Ganga as it literally starts from above the actual origin of Ganga. Shining bright during the sunset at this beautiful land.

Torna Fort was the first fort captured by Shivaji Maharaj in 1643, making it the nucleus of the Maratha Empire. After centuries, it has now become a popular destination for adventure lovers. The hill has an elevation of 1,403 metres (4,603 ft) above sea level, making it the highest hill-fort in the district.

Why one should plan a visit to Aberdeen to explore the real Hong Kong?

Travel 20 minutes from Hong Kong's modern city life and you'll find Aberdeen fishing village - a charming and traditional neighborhood that feels like a step back in time. Explore sampans, house-boats and floating fishing market against the backdrop of rolling hills and towering skyscrapers. This beautiful neighborhood has become a world-famous travel spot forÂ its floating village and floating seafood restaurants. 
#DiscoverHongkong with #Thrillophilia

Why Dragon's Back is one of the best tourist attractions in Hong Kong?

Far from the hustle-bustle of Hong Kong city, immerse yourself in the lap of nature on a half-day outing at the Dragon's Back Trail. Trekking the undulating ridge that resembles a dragon's back, one is rewarded with stunning views of southern Hong Kong Island and a relaxing time on Big Wave Bay beach. Gaze over the South China Sea, and swim or relax on the beach to end your perfect getaway to Dragon's Back.

#DiscoverHongkong with #Thrillophilia

Why Lantau Island is a must-visit when in Hong Kong?

The Lantau Island on the western side of the Hong Kong peninsula boasts excellent beaches with wide stretches of golden sand and dramatic ocean views, exciting hiking trails, picturesque villages, and the mighty Big Buddha. With exciting experiences such as shopping, sightseeing, and adventure, a visit to Lantau Island is sure to be a hit.

So this is one video, where I just am myself. (like literally no make up,no filters)
I was in the great Himalayan national park for 4 days. During my time here, I lived in a small blue tent.
with fresh air in my lungs the only thing that mattered to me was how I felt! I woke up every day asking the same crucial question to myself and carried out my trek.
.
In this world where external validation is  must and pressure of looking good is high at all the times, we often forget to take care of our souls.
.
Not having to look in the mirror all these days, a thought popped in my head!! how romantic would it be, if we groomed our minds and cleansed our hearts every single day.
. 
Self Love is and will always be one epic love story!ğŸ¨ğŸ’š
.
.
.
.

Here is what Raghunandan Gupta has to say about his fascinating experience with us

It all started with mesmerizing views of Shillong. We went for the cave exploration and after that enjoyed the beautiful waterfalls of Cherrapunji. It's the best place to be.

We camped at Dawki river, the cleanest river in India with water as clear as a glass sheet. This is by far the most beautiful place I have visited around the country.

After this journey, I would say that Meghalaya has India's most dense caves explorations and have the most beautiful natural creations. It has all the landscapes Mountains, Waterfalls, Forests.
.
Thanks to Thrillophilia for fulfilling my every recommendation it was very much professional by your side."

Canyoneering at Kawasan falls in Cebu is the most extreme adventure in Philippines and it's a must do for adventure lovers.
